dbPhase.hypeerweb

Class HyPeerWebDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • dbPhase.hypeerweb.HyPeerWebDatabase

  • public class HyPeerWebDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
    The helper class that allows saving and loading the HyPeerWeb from the database. 

     Domain:
      DATABASE_DIRECTORY     : String
      DEFAULT_DATABASE_NAME : String
      singleton : HyPeerWebDatabase
      connection : Connection
    Author:
    Konrad Rywelski

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String DATABASE_DIRECTORY
      The name of the directory that holds databases associated with HyPeerWebs.
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_DATABASE_NAME
      The default name of the file that holds the sqlite3 database.

    • Field Detail

      • DATABASE_DIRECTORY

        public static java.lang.String DATABASE_DIRECTORY
        The name of the directory that holds databases associated with HyPeerWebs. Currently it is "db". Of course the directory location is relative to where the HyPeerWeb program starts.

      • DEFAULT_DATABASE_NAME

        public static java.lang.String DEFAULT_DATABASE_NAME
        The default name of the file that holds the sqlite3 database. Currently it is "HyPeerWeb.db".

    • Method Detail

      • getSingleton

        public static HyPeerWebDatabase getSingleton()
        Gets the single HyPeerWebDatabase.
        Returns:
        the single HyPeerWebDatabase
        Precondition:
        singleton=null OR initHyPeerWebDatabase() have been called previously
        Postcondition:
        return=singleton

      • initHyPeerWebDatabase

        public static void initHyPeerWebDatabase()
        Creates and loads a HyPeerWebDatabase. Should be one of the first things called when creating a HyPeerWeb.
        Precondition:
        There must exist a database with the name given by DEFAULT_DATABASE_NAME.
        Postcondition:
        The connection is set there are 3 tables in DEFAULT_DATABASE_NAME database

      • initHyPeerWebDatabase

        public static void initHyPeerWebDatabase(java.lang.String dbName)
        Creates and loads a HyPeerWebDatabase. Should be one of the first things called when creating a HyPeerWeb.
        Parameters:
        dbName - The name of the database
        Precondition:
        dbName = null OR |dbName| = 0 OR There must exist a database with the given dbName.
        Postcondition:
        The connection is set there are 3 tables in dbName database

      • save

        public void save(java.util.Collection<Node> nodes)
        Saves the HyPeerWeeb to the current database
        Parameters:
        nodes - collection of nodes that belong to the HyPeerWeb that is to be saved
        Precondition:
        the tables of the current database are already prefilled OR they are empty
        Postcondition:
        there is an entry in the Nodes table for every Node in the nodes collection for every node pairs of neighbors and surrogate neighbors are saved in the database

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the current database.
        Precondition:
        tables already exist in the current database OR they don't exist
        Postcondition:
        there are no tables in the current database

      • loadNodeSet

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Node> loadNodeSet()
        Loads the HyPeerWeb from the current database.
        Returns:
        HashMap set of nodes that belong to the loaded database
        Precondition:
        singleton != NULL
        Postcondition:
        the return HashMap contains all the information of the HyPeerWeb that is to be loaded

      • getNode

        public SimplifiedNodeDomain getNode(int webId)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a SimplifiedNodeDomain representing the node with indicated webId. The information is retrieved from the database.
        Parameters:
        webId - - The webId of the node whose information we are going to retrieve.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        Precondition:
        There exists a node in the database with the given webId.
        Postcondition:
        result contains the webId, neighbors, upPointers, downPointers, fold, surrogateFold, and inverse surrogate fold of the indicated node.
